[h1]We do what we must because we can.[/h1]
[b] [Pay-to-Play], Great experience. [/b]
[hr][/hr]
Second and (sadly) last Portal game published by Valve, [u]Portal 2[/u] is an amazing experience.
In this portal-based puzzle game, you play as Chell, a test subject who's been sleeping for too long, following the events of Portal. The story is great, and the same can be said for the gameplay and ambiance of the game. It is one of "Valve's classics" and definitely requires a try.
[hr][/hr]
[b] [SIDENOTE] [/b] This game also contain a multiplayer mode that contains a story as well as the possibility to play and create player-made test chambers.
Playing [u]Portal[/u] is obviously recommended before playing [u]Portal 2[/u].

https://store.steampowered.com/app/400/Portal/
Ce jeu est super! Il nécésite de la concentration et de la logique.

Like its predecessor Portal I really liked this game because of:
a) great story - (I even didn`t foresee the great and funny twist at the end)
b) cool gameplay (difficult & cool riddels, cool interaction with the funny small bot Weathly and someone quite familiar)
c) very cool voice actors (wonderful quality and dialogs)

It also wasn`t as long as other games, but after you finished there is a 2-Player-Mode, you can build your own test rooms or you can play it again, because of it`s very funny :D

All in all i really enjoyed playing Portal and even more playing Portal 2. The game is despite it length and not latest graphics unbelievable cool and super fun!!!

Portal 2 ile alakası var mı bilmiyorum. Çünkü Portal 2 yi bitirmedim. Bu modu Portal 2 yi bitirmeden önce denemiştim. Gayet güzel bir mod. Oyunu indirimde alın derim. Aldığınız da 2 tane oyun alıyormuş gibi olacak. Ha bir de co-op modu var. Co-op modu ile arkadaşınızla eğlenceli vakitler geçiriyorsunuz. En iyi yanlarından biri de bu. Umarım inceleme işinize yaramıştır. İyi Oyunlar :))

I definitely recommend Portal 2, but I don't if you haven't played the first one. There are some necessary story elements that transfer from the first to the second game. I will end up giving spoilers to the first game here, probably. Who knows. It depends on my writing process.
 Anyways, this game exceeded my expectations. This one is the harder of the two Portal games. It's very, very enjoyable. In my review of Portal 1, I gave a crash course of the game mechanics, so I don't feel the need to do so here, but I will give you some information on the new mechanics. Along with the basic Portal gun and lazer technology in the last game, this game has many different features, such as gel. That is one of the biggest new features. You use this gel for bouncing, speeding up, and even creating Portals on surfaces you coudn't before you put the gel, there. 
This game, though. I dare not give you spoilers, because the story is astounding. I will say, though, the characters are always great in these games, and always memorable. In this game, you of course have GLaDOS, from the first game. The song at the end of the first game, "Still Alive" was actually hinting at the sequel, and I didn't realize it, but I should have. It was very obvious. GLaDOS, in that song, was just letting everyone know that she's still alive! And, you have a new character: Wheatley. Wheatley is a hilarious character. He's a moron, but he's hilarious and has a wonderful character arc. You're sure to love him. This game is my favorite Valve game I've ever played. Of course, I haven't finished Half Life, yet, though. So, I have to finish that, too. But this is a good game. I give it a 9.9 our of 10. It's a great game! I only wish the cake made a return....

(The edit of this reviews simply added paragraph breaks for your reading pleasure)

[h1]This article analyzes the tone and design of the excellent single-player campaigns in [i]Portal[/i] and [i]Portal 2[/i], eventually concluding that the original [i]Portal[/i] is the stronger title.[/h1]

[. . .] I think it’s appropriate to close by reiterating that [i]Portal 2[/i] is a wonderful game. It’s fun and highly polished; its co-op campaign is one of the best co-op experiences ever devised; and its level editor and accompanying Steam workshop integration are practically endless sources of new content. [. . .]

[url=http://thegemsbok.com/art-reviews-and-articles/mid-week-mission-portal-valve/][Click here to continue reading this review][/url]

An awesome sequel to the first and one of the best games ever made. 
Although having a storyline twice as long as the first it by no means gets boring as it is fine-tuned from the first to perfection incorporating a humorous dialog and with more diverse/interesting puzzles incorporating more advanced mechanics, new tools and objects you have to utilise or hide from in order to manipulate your body to pass through inside and outside the test chambers. 

I doubt Valve will make a third as Portal 2 chambers are able to be made by the community, yes that’s right, we now have tens of thousands of chambers you can attempt, ranging from easy to terribly hard all created and shared by the Portal 2 Community in the steam workshop.

But wait, did I mention Portal 2 also has a co-operative mode? Yes that’s right you and a friend can work your way through Valve’s or the thousands of community chambers designed specifically where the need for two players is required to complete the chamber.

Brilliant thinking/puzzle game, so make sure you “Contribute to Science”, purchase the game and “Keep On Testing”!!!

Really entertaining game for those of you looking for a challenge. If you choose to use an xbox 360 wireless controller however, be weary that the time delay between your commands and the receiver will be annoying to deal with for some challenging puzzles. I confirmed when I switched to keyboard and had no difficulty finishing, with the controller I was at it for over 10 minutes getting pissed off. Overall great game and enjoyed the story. I found it as good as the first one and a little more challenging.

So in brief this is another masterpiece form VALVE . 
Portal 2 is the second episode of Portal and continues the escape of the main protagonist Chell out of the aperture science facilities . However one day you wake up in an emergency case and a friendly core named Wheatly greets and guides you through the facility . During that route you came across mossy claimed rooms - Aperture Science is no longer active . Finally you reach the controll panel elevator and unfortunately activate and reactivate GLADos . Now the story continues ...

Like i said before , Valves second episode of Portal is also a masterpiece ! New puzzle elements such as the repulsion gel was added and more . BEsides that the pc community can enjoy creating and manufactureing new test chamber with the new chamber editor and you can also share your masterwork of chambers in the workshop-section Portal 2 .
I can and will recommend Portal 2 evertime to everyone ! 
So all of you who enjoy a great story and puzzles buy Portal and Portal 2 !!!

Sequels that actually outshine their predecessors are one of my favorite things in life, so this is one of my favorite games. Portal doubles down on the complexity of puzzles, and polishes everything with a more intricate story that delves into the history of Aperture. Betrayal, heartbreak, humor, and what I thought was one of the most clever twist endings ever designed around a puzzle. As one reviewer, who did not apparently enjoy the first Portal, hailed the game: "you'll probably find yourself not enjoying Portal 2 but who the ♥♥♥♥ knows cause apparently Portal 2 is the second coming of Jesus." They were mostly right.

12/10

[h1]AT A GLANCE[/h1]
(Full review follows below)

[list]
[*] [b]Game Name:[/b] Portal 2
[*] [b]Original Release:[/b] 2011
[*] [b]Genre Tags:[/b] Innovative; Puzzle; Sci-Fi; Action; Funny
[*] [b]My Overall Grade:[/b] A+
[*] [b]Estimated Playtime (Campaign):[/b] 3-6 hours
[*] [b]Multiplayer Aspect:[/b] Optional and Auxiliary
[*] [b]Recommended To:[/b] Established fans of the genre; Those intrigued by the genre; Novelty seekers; Casual gamers; Multiplayer gamers 
[/list]	

[h1]REVIEW[/h1]
[b]Portal 2[/b] takes everything that was done right in the first game and injects it with steroids. It boasts a longer, more diverse campaign that still manages to hold on to the humor, atmosphere, and overall quality that made the original so enjoyable. It also boasts a new cooperative mode, which brings the experience to a new level. And to top it off, with Steam Workshop integration, the possibilities for new content become limitless.

In the campaign, all of the strengths from the first game return and are fine-tuned to perfection. The puzzles are more diverse and interesting, with more advanced mechanics introduced. The atmosphere is even more fleshed out and enticing. The dialogue is even more hilarious and entertaining. And to top it all off, the game is about twice as long.

After that, there is also an incredibly well designed cooperative mode, complete with its own characters and puzzles. This adds what is effectively another whole game to the mix, which is a very welcome addition.

And to top it all off, with the Steam Workshop integration, there is endless possibilities for new puzzle rooms in both single-player and cooperative modes. Not all of it is great, of course, but some of it is arguably better than the real game.  It is a gift that just keeps on giving.

With the gameplay being so intuitive and enjoyable, and the limitless possibilities of the Workshop, [b]Portal 2[/b] rockets to the clouds as a deity among video games.  It is hands-down one of the absolute best games in existence.  If you haven’t yet tried it, now is the time.  There are hours of entertainment waiting for you. 

[i][url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/murphyslawyercuration#curation]Follow my curation page to see more of my recommendations![/url][/i]
